intro: Epilobium × dumortieri, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated edge. Its flowers are showy, with five petals, and are typically pink or red in color. It is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats across Europe and parts of Asia.
